rev.comment: Reverting per capita income to what it was before. The claim that it was $27,000 is OUTRAGEOUS and is one of the most obviously widely inaccurate edits to Wikipedia I have ever seen.
Bot: [[af:Duitse Demokratiese Republiek]] is a featured article
Added URL with information about TLD .dd
/* Major Cities in East Germany */ "Berlin, Hauptstadt der DDR" was the official name of East Berlin (commonly used as "Berlin" in East Germany)
it is quoted by the Berlin Wall book as being this way..
removing incorrect fact - the book states exatly the oposite
/* Other notable East Germans */ see talk
/* Other notable East Germans */ see talk
/* Major Cities in East Germany */ BI-Universallexikon A - Z; 1. Auflage; VEB Bibliographisches Institut Leipzig; 1988

precision: "was a self-declared [[socialist state]] (but often referred to in the West as a '[[communist state]]') "
add back reparations, with cite (see History article for details)
/* Stamps and philately */ deleting POV, please offer evidence of this, otherwise it is a questionable assumption.
/* Holidays */ This commemorative day wasn't a holiday

/* External links */ Re-added Soviet satellite states category. Please stop removing this. East Germany was a Soviet satellite state.

It is more accurate to describe the former GDR as a communist state. That is why, for example, the text box in the article (scroll down) refers to this article as part of a series on Communism.

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 210671110 by [[Special:Contributions/Wiggy!|Wiggy!]] ([[User talk:Wiggy!|talk]]) certainly not after 1989, and we don't call West Germany a U.S. satellite either
standard part of the info box and of sufficient veracity to hold up as NPOV
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 210433008 by [[Special:Contributions/CadenS|CadenS]] ([[User talk:CadenS|talk]]) Thhat's right - and that's why East Germany is the bloody common name.
The conventional long name of GDR was never used in the western world. The name "East Germany" was the one used.
Yeah, but that wasn't the conventional long name, and the use of East Germany is covered off in the article itself.
GDR was known as "East Germany" in the western world.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 210069995 by [[Special:Contributions/71.146.141.105|71.146.141.105]] Needn't gild the lilly
A common name is not an official name, North Korea is not officially called North Korea and the articlle for it does not show "(North Korea)" under its official name
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/72.156.101.190|72.156.101.190]] ([[User talk:72.156.101.190|talk]]) to last version by CadenS
"East Germany" was its official name in the western world
In the infobox "East Germany" should not be shown as its official name, it was a common term used to describe the state, but was not its official name
/* Economy */ rephrase, rm mention of Baade jetliner as having entered the world market - it never did
/* Economy */ [[World Bank]] viewed GDR inhabitants as having a higher [[GDP]] per head of population than the [[UK]]

Removing [[:Image:427px-DDR_Verwaltungsbezirke_farbig.svg.png|image]] with no source information. Such images that are older than seven days may be deleted at any time.
/* Military of East Germany */ Fixed link
The correct translation of 'Bezirk' is 'district' not 'county'. As well there existed counties as subdivisions of the districts.
there where no states after 1952 in the GDR
the GDR didn't have states. Their creation came into effect as they joined the federal republic.

fix grammar, elucidate, add links. "EG" is neither informal nor inaccurate use to native English speakers.
[[German Democratic Republic]] was proper name. East Germany is only a misleading, sloppy, informal name

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/82.92.186.96|82.92.186.96]] ([[User talk:82.92.186.96|talk]]) to last version by Hitler's Dick
Removed {{Soviet occupation}}, as the German article is now [[Soviet occupation zone]].
Keßler was a minister before the orthography reform, so we should use the old spelling when referring to him in ministerial capacity.
You'll find out the hard way that politically-driven oversimplification rules the day: thus the notion of the final "phase of communism" is blurred by invoking the oxymoron term "[[Communist state]]"
Removed "communist state" in favor of "socialist country". Although DDR wanted to achieve communism, it never reached that stage and is henceforth socialist, just as USSR wasn't "Union of Communist".
wikilink anthem, add quotes for song title and italics for German.
/* History */ competition was wider than just athletics
Protected East Germany: no more moving without discussion [move=sysop]
